Row.Text: So be it. The Indian people will not resist your attack. Except perhaps for the ones with all of the weapons.
Unfortunately, not everybody in my country is as committed to non-violence as I am, so please let me apologize in advance if your forces are destroyed to the last man.
I have just been informed that a large number of our soldiers have entered your territory. I strongly recommend a campaign of passive resistance as the best way to defeat them.
I am sending a contingent of Indian soldiers on a goodwill tour of your major cities. I trust that they will be received with open arms.
It appears that our soldiers admire your civilization so much that a large number of them have decided to move there, permanently.
You may have vanquished our armies, but you will never vanquish the Indian spirit.
You have conquered an innocent and helpless people. I congratulate you.
You have conquered us. If you wish to ease your terrible karmic burden and not return in the next life as a dung beetle, I urge you to be merciful in victory.
India heartily thanks you for the following donation in the interests of world peace and tranquility.
My friend, can you spare us this?
India is poor; you are rich. Perhaps your considerable karmic burden could be eased by giving this to us.
In the name of the peaceful Indian people, I greet you.
Welcome! I trust that our peoples can share the world's bounty in peaceful harmony!
In the name of the Indian people, I offer you my hand in friendship!
I am glad that we are once again at peace, no matter the cost.
It is wrong to accept certainties.
I regard myself as a soldier, though a soldier of peace.
The ideally non-violent state will be an ordered anarchy. That State is the best governed which is governed the least.
I am a pacifist - not a fool. You'll need to do better than this.
You must do better than that.
Much as it pains me, I do not see how I can agree to these terms; can you not do a little better?
Is that the best you can do?
This is not fair to the Indian people. Kindly improve your offer.
Can you do a little better?
To agree to such terms would be foolish indeed. No thank you.
With regret, I am unable to agree to your terms at this time.
Such an agreement would not be in the best interest of the Indian people.
You are wiser than you appear. I agree to your terms.
Agreed. I believe that we will both profit equally from this exchange.
Surely your unfortunate civilization could benefit by trading with its betters?
My friend, are you interested in this arrangement?
Fair trade benefits everyone, don't you agree?
My generals tell me that they are unable to deliver the items you request. However, they encourage you to 'come and get some.' I'm not exactly sure what they mean by that.
That hardly seems reasonable. We are your friends, not your slaves.
While I firmly believe in non-violence, the Indian people are not yet so enlightened. They laugh heartily at your demands.
Naked greed is not a good trait in a leader. However, to keep the peace we will accede to your demands.
Certainly! I can refuse you nothing.
It is worth it to keep the peace. We agree.
I told you that violence is futile! Let this be a lesson to you: You would certainly have triumphed if you had used passive resistance against our forces!
Nonviolence triumphs once more! Perhaps now you understand the true power of passive resistance!
